Good idea, Shayd. My levels go from 350 to 399. I played them back, and most 
of them aren't as difficult as I intended, so I suggest people try them on 
the more difficult settings. The killer levels will be hard on any setting.

Sorry about the mix-up, Light. If you want, I could link into your levels 
from my Garden of Golden Apples and connect them all. I originally intended 
to have my scenarios branch off of level 12 registered, but the original 
would always overwrite my version. Strangely enough, the modified map came 
up just fine... but the .FSS file didn't work. I would have had an exit into 
Tryxian Chronicles, but I think those levels are of poor quality.

As far as new abilities go, I think ghosts deserve a new power--maybe 
"Haunt", to have it focus on a particular location or enemy. Giant skeletons 
and golems are unbalanced characters, so they should have special attacks 
for close range. Maybe "Squash" for golems, and "Chew and swallow enemy" or 
"Stomp" for giant skeletons. Fire elementals should have an attack for 
single foes... "Ignite" as a lasting heartburst-like effect would kick. 
Unfortunately, it seems that Forgotten Sages won't be doing any coding 
anytime soon. Oh well...
         -Tevildo, Prince of Cats.
